alert.note: Alert for Florence; Forest; Northern Marinette County; Northern Oconto County; Southern Marinette County; Southern Oconto County (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 21 at 4:22PM CST until December 22 at 6:00PM CST by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...A PROLONGED PERIOD OF WINTRY WEATHER WILL RESULT IN TRAVEL DISRUPTIONS LEADING INTO THE HOLIDAY WEEKEND... .A slow moving storm system will bring a prolonged period of wintry weather to the area the next several days. The initial phase of the storm will consist of mainly snow, which will fall from this afternoon through tomorrow. The second phase will consist of lighter snows, but very windy conditions with significant blowing and drifting snow. Finally, very cold air will surge into the area on the strong northwest winds. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CST THURSDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY EVENING THROUGH LATE FRIDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 4 and 8 inches. For the Winter Storm Watch, blowing and drifting snow possible with additional snow accumulations up to three inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Wisconsin. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 6 PM CST Thursday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Thursday evening through late Friday night. * IMPACTS...Snow will result in slippery roads and hazardous travel conditions at times tonight through Thursday. Travel conditions could become dangerous at times Thursday night through Friday night when winds increase. The strong winds will result in widespread blowing and drifting snow, and possibly near-zero visibility at times in open areas.
info.instruction: Hazardous travel conditions are expected late tonight through Thursday. Even worse travel conditions are possible late Thursday night through Friday night. Consider avoiding travel during this period unless absolutely necessary. If you must travel during this period, drive with extreme caution. Consider taking a winter storm kit along with you, including such items as tire chains, booster cables, flashlight, shovel, blankets and extra clothing. Also take water, a first aid kit, and anything else that would help you survive in case you become stranded. Be sure your vehicle has sufficient fuel before crossing open areas.
